KnowledgeBase.Title: isPair
KnowledgeBase.ArgumentTypes:
Character String Symbol Vector BitVector ByteVector IntVector
FltVector ObjVector Structure Dictionary Directory Brick Pair List Matrix NumMatrix Integer Float Number Complex Boolean
KnowledgeBase.RelatedFunctions: isType isString isText isSymbol isBitVector isPcodeVector isVector isByteVector isNumberVector isFloatVector isIntegerVector isNumberMatrix isStructure isDictionary isDirectory isObjectVector

Function.Description: The isPair function returns true if the argument object is a Pair or a List; otherwise false is returned.

Brief.Overview: The isPair Function returns true if the argument {obj} is a Pair or a List; otherwise false is returned.
Brief.Usage: The isPair function is used to query an object to determine if it is a Pair or a List.

Argument.Name: obj
Argument.AISTypes:
Character, String, Symbol, Vector, BitVector, ByteVector, IntVector,
FltVector, ObjVector, Structure, Dictionary, Directory, Pair, List
Matrix, NumMatrix, Integer, Float, Number, Complex, Brick

Syntax.Return: Boolean value true if the object is a Pair or List, otherwise false is returned.
